news_header: Salon owners warn of potential apprenticeship shortages due to financial pressures and high taxes.
news_original_title: 'Perfect storm' could see end of salon apprenticeships
news_text: Salon owners are warning that financial pressures and high taxes could lead to a shortage of apprenticeships in the hairdressing industry. The British Hair Consortium is urging government reform to alleviate these issues, as many salons struggle with VAT and employment costs. Without changes, opportunities for new apprentices may drastically decline by 2027, impacting the future of the industry.
